place.name: RUDBAXTON
place.gazetteerText: RUDBAXTON, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; adjacent to the West Cleddau river, 3 miles N of Haverfordwest r. station. Post-town, Haverfordwest. Acres, 4, 142. Real property, £3, 743. Pop., 586. Houses, 130. The property is much subdivided. Wythy-Bush is a chief residence. Poyston was the birthplace of Gen. Picton. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Davids. Value, £199.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
